revised_title: Experiments on Combustion of Explosive Mixtures and Flame Characteristics
tldr: Davy investigates the combustion of explosive mixtures confined by wire-gauze and observes flame behavior. He concludes that the heat communicated by flame depends on its mass and that a current established from below upwards prevents explosions within cylinders. This research led to the development of safer mine lamps, which were successfully tested in coal mines near Newcastle.
